Sentencas: Gd-doped ceria solid solutions have been recognized to be leading electrolytes for use in intermediate-temperature fuel cells.
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: In this paper, the preparation, solubility, and densification of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 ceramics derived from carbonate co-precipitation are reported.
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The dissolution of Gd2O3 in CeO2 lattice was identified to be completed during the co-precipitation process by studying the lattice parameter as a function of temperature.
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: After calcination at 800 degrees C for 2 h, the nano-sized Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 powder (similar to 33 nm) with a nearly spherical shape and a narrow particle-size distribution was obtained.
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: This calcined powder has high sinterability and maximum densification rate at similar to 1000 degrees C. Sintering at 1300 degrees C for 4 h yielded over 97% relative density with near maximum.
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The grain size increased with increases in sintering temperature.
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The ionic conductivity of these pellets was tested by alternating current impedance spectroscopy to elucidate the contribution of intragranular and intergranular conductivity to the total ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: It was found that sintering temperature does not affect intragranular conductivity, though intergranular conductivity was strongly influenced by grain size, grain boundary area, and relativity density.
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: This pellet sintered at 1500 degrees C for 4 h showed a high ionic conductivity of 5.90 x 10(-2)
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: s/cm when measured at 750 degrees C.
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The characterization and structural evaluation of the as-received powders were carried out using x-ray diffraction, transmission electron microscopy, Brunauer-Emmett-Teller, and dilatometer and impedance analysis.
Titulo: Consolidation and properties of Gd0.1Ce0.9O1.95 nanoparticles for solid-oxide fuel cell electrolytes
